Massive fire breaks out at pesticide fac.description: MEERUT: A massive fire broke out at a pesticide factory in Meerut’s Mohkampur industrial area on Saturday at around 3:30am. The fire, which became difficult to control due to the chemicals stocked inside the factory, spread to another unit of the factory and an adjacent factory which manufactured paper glasses. Nobody was injured, however, losses worth lakhs were reported. Sanjeev Kumar Singh, fire station officer, said, "The fire occurred at one Paramount Pesticides owned by Ajay Gupta in Mohkampur area on Saturday early morning at 3:30am. Fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the fire, but since inflammable chemicals used in manufacturing pesticides were stocked here, it became difficult to control the fire. The fire spread to the adjacent second unit of the factory and another factory which manufactured paper glasses." While the firemen were able to save the paper glasses factory and one unit of Paramount Pesticides, the second unit of the factory got engulfed in fire completely. “In one unit of the pesticides factory, chemicals were stocked on the ground floor. Due to the massive fire, the first floor collapsed thereby trapping the chemicals in rubble and hence making fire fighting difficult,” said Singh, who said that till 10am as many as nine fire tenders were used to douse the fire. “We asked for one fire tender from Muzaffarnagar for help, and if needed more fire tenders from adjacent districts will be asked for. No casualties have been reported since nobody was there inside the factory at the time of the incident. The reason behind the fire isn’t clear, however, it looks like short circuit might be the reason behind it,” said Singh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Muzaffarnagar: Two die, six injured afte.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: Two persons were killed and six others, including two children, critically injured after a speeding car rammed into a bike on Meerapur road in Muzaffarnagar’s Khatauli. The two persons on the bike, Yogesh (40) and Rajender (60), died on the spot. The six persons in the car continue to be in a critical condition as the car crashed into a nearby tree. The deceased were residents of Behsuma of Meerut. The incident took place in the afternoon on Meerapur road, an accident-prone stretch, when the car’s driver lost control over the steering, ramming into a bike and then hitting a tree. A passer-by dialed 100 and a police team from Khatauli area, along with an ambulance, rushed to the spot. All the victims were shifted to a hospital, where Yogesh and Rajender were declared brought dead. According to station house officer (SHO) of Khatauli police station Har Sharan Sharma, “The bodies have been sent for autopsy, while the injured have been referred to a higher center in Meerut. An investigation is underway.” It should be noted that Khatuli has the reputation of being an accident-prone area. In May, three people died and two others were injured after a UP roadways bus rammed into a car in Muzaffarnagar’s Khatauli area. In March, a major accident claimed several lives in Khatauli. While five people had died, three were injured after an SUV rammed into a dumper truck, which had been wrongly parked on the roadside. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Journalist assaulted by cops: Two-member.description: MEERUT: Days after a Shamli-based journalist Amit Sharma was assaulted by cops at GRP station, a two-member team of Press Council of India (PCI) comprising Jai Shankar Gupta and Uttam Chand Sharma reached Shamli on Saturday morning. The team held a closed door meeting with local journalists at a city hotel. It also recorded the victim’s statement and of other journalists who were present at the spot when the incident took place. The team visited the local GRP station as well. This comes a day after NHRC issued a notice to UP DGP OP Singh calling for a detailed report in the matter, including action taken against the guilty public servants and status of the FIR registered against them. “Going by the reported allegations, this kind of cruel and uncivilised act by a public servant is highly disgraceful and cannot be tolerated in a civilised society,” the human rights body stated in a release. “Stern action should be taken against the police personnel if found guilty so that such a barbaric act is not repeated by any public servant in future,” the release added. A case against four police personnel, including SHO Rakesh Kumar under the IPC sections 323 (causing hurt), 504 (intentional insult), 506 (criminal intimidation), 364 (abduction), 392 (punishment for robbery) and 342 (wrongful confinement) has been lodged at GRP police station after the assault. Out of the four accused, SHO Kumar and another constable were suspended soon after the incident. It all began on Tuesday evening when GRP personnel entered into an argument with Sharma when the latter was covering the derailment of a goods train in Shamli. Several videos of the attack went viral after the incident in which SHO Kumar could be seen attacking Sharma near the derailment site at Dhimanpur area of the district. The victim also claimed he was stripped by cops and Kumar urinated in his mouth. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

UP govt doctors wear black band in solid.description: LUCKNOW: Government doctors across Uttar Pradesh on Friday wore black bands to express solidarity with their counterparts protesting violence against two of their colleagues in West Bengal. The step was taken in response to a call for a four-day nationwide protest by Indian Medical Association (IMA) on Friday. Dr Amit Singh, general secretary of Provincial Medical Services Association, UP, said, “Government doctors wore black bands while discharging their duties at various hospitals in the state. In the afternoon, a delegation of the doctors submitted a memorandum addressed to the Prime Minister through the district magistrate." In the memorandum, “We have demanded security for doctors so that they do not feel scared” while discharging their duties. He added that more than 18,700 doctors who are members of the Provincial Medical Services Association, UP took part in the protest. Junior doctors in West Bengal are on a strike since Tuesday after two of their colleagues were attacked by a mob and seriously injured at NRS Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata following the death of a 75-year-old patient who died of a cardiac arrest. The incident raised concerns regarding security of doctors. In Meerut, doctors under the banner of Indian Medical Association, wore helmets and black badges in protest and demanded proper security for doctors so that they can work properly. “We condemn the incident and it is just sad that doctors who save people’s lives are being attacked. We need a safe and secure environment to function, or else we will not be able to admit any serious patients. This is because if there is a high probability of death of a person, the chances are that his family will be annoyed and might attack us,” said Dr Shishir Jain, president, Meerut Indian Medical Association (IMA) unit. As a mark of protest, doctors in Meerut wore helmets and black badges while they tended to their patients on Friday. “If our demands of providing adequate security to doctors are not met, then the doctors will go on strike. However, due to the protest, only common man suffers,” said Dr Jain, who condemned the incident and demanded strict action against the perpetrators of this heinous crime. Dr Raghvendra Sharma, vice-president of IMA's Bareilly unit, said “More than 25 doctors gathered on Friday and donned black ribbons on their arm. We have sent a mail to the Prime Minister's Office to condemn the Kolkata incident." In Pilibhit, a delegation of doctors associated with the IMA demanded constitution of a district-level committee comprising a senior police officer not below the rank of additional superintendent of police, the chief medical officer and a designated delegate of IMA to ensure safe working environment for medical professionals. The delegation was called for empowering this committee to review all cases of violence against doctors and enforce prompt legal action against the assailants. The delegation handed over a memorandum of demands to additional district magistrate, (finance and revenue), Atul Singh, which was addressed to the Prime Minister. “We have demanded a new legislation from the Prime Minister to protect doctors and their medical establishments from violence as everyone in the country has the right to work in a safe environment,” said Dr Deepak Kumar Gangwar, district general secretary of IMA in Pilibhit. OP Yadav, IMA secretary for Agra district said, “In solidarity with our colleagues in West Bengal, doctors wore a black ribbon on their arm and gathered at the district collectorate to handover a memorandum to the district magistrate and senior superintendent of police. They demanded adequate arrangement for strict implementation of the UP Medical Protection Act. Violence in hospitals adversely affects patient care and institutions will be reluctant to take up complicated and risky patients which will affect critical care. A national law against violence in hospitals has to be brought in urgently that should provide a minimum of seven years of imprisonment for hospital violence.” (With inputs from Ishita Bhatia from Meerut, Priyangi Agarwal from Bareilly, Keshav Agrawal from Pilibhit and Deepak Lavania from Agra) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP: Juvenile held for raping 8-year-old.description: BAREILLY: A 17-year-old boy was arrested on Thursday for allegedly raping an eight-year-old girl in a village under jurisdiction of Nawabganj police station. The minor was raped on Wednesday, when she had gone out to fetch water from a nearby hand pump. The accused took the girl to a secluded place and raped her. Station house officer of Nawabganj, inspector Rajesh Kumar Singh, said, “The accused, who hails from a minority community, had been in correction home for raping a girl in 2017 and was released only seven months ago.” After producing him in court, he has again been sent to juvenile home on Friday. Superintendent of police (rural area) Sansar Singh said, “While going through CCTV footage, installed at a nearby college, we spotted a man in red shirt and black trousers taking the survivor on his bicycle. During investigation, we learnt that two juvenile were nabbed and sent to juvenile home in 2017 on charges of raping two girls of the same village.” Police said that they took the boys in custody and produced them before the girl. “Seeing her tormentor the girl was frightened but was able to identify him. Over brief interrogation, the accused confessed of raping the girl. Since the accused juvenile hails from minority community and rape survivor is from other community, chances were high that the matter would take communal turn. However, we have deployed adequate police force there and the situation is now completely under control,” SHO said. On Wednesday when the survivor was going to fetch water from a nearby hand pump, accused juvenile, who came on a bicycle, told the girl that her father was calling her but he took her to a secluded place where he allegedly raped her. The accused later dropped the girl near her home. The survivor narrated the ordeals to her mother in the evening. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Asaduddin Owaisi.description: NEW DELHI: Asaduddin Owaisi, president of All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM), was greeted with slogans of 'Jai Shri Ram', 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' and 'Vande Mataram' on Tuesday as he went on to take oath as a member of the 17th Lok Sabha here. Owaisi, a Member of Parliament (MP) from Hyderabad constituency, in response, said, "Jai Bheem, Jai Meem, Takbeer Allahu Akbar, Jai Hind" while concluding his oath. Later, responding to opposition's gesture, Owaisi told ANI, "I think, it's good that they remember such things after seeing me. I hope they remember our constitution and the deaths of children in Muzaffarpur as well. I will keep an eye on them." Besides, Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) lone MP from Punjab's Sangrur, Bhagwant Mann, raised 'Inquilab Zindabad' slogans at the end of his oath-taking ceremony earlier today. #WATCH: Slogans of Bharat Mata ki Jai and Vande Mataram raised in the Lok Sabha as AIMIM MP from Hyderabad Asaduddi… https://t.co/6QTgnFYG6x— ANI (@ANI) 1560854690000This comes after BJP MP from Bhopal Pragya Singh Thakur ended her oath taking ceremony with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan on Monday. Subsequently, every BJP member continued to raise slogans. Moreover, chants of 'Jai Shri Ram' marked the oath-taking by minister Babual Supriyo, elected from Asansol in West Bengal, where the chanting of the slogan became a political issue during the recent elections. The furore over 'Jai Shri Ram' slogan started in the state after West Bengal chief minister Banerjee lost her cool when a group of men chanted 'Jai Shri Ram' as her convoy was passing through Bhatpara area in North 24 Parganas district earlier this month. Man kidnaps eight-month-old nephew as pa.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: Local police have rescued an eight-month-old toddler and arrested his uncle and his accomplice for kidnapping. According to police, the baby, Avi, went missing from his house in Colony Niyajupura, where is mother, Mamta, is staying with her parents. Avi was sleeping while his mother was busy with household chores on Saturday afternoon. His parents approached City police station and filed a complaint about the missing baby. Superintendent of police Sudhir Kumar formed three police teams to find the baby. According to police sources, a search was launched across the district but to no avail. During investigation, police found that Mamta's brother, Sachin, appeared to be panic-stricken and was trying to divert police attention toward a street vendor. Police decided to question him. During sustained questioning, Sachin broke down and confessed to having kidnapped his nephew for the sake of his married girlfriend Sachin said handed over the baby to his paramour who already has three daughters but desperate to have a son. Late on Saturday night, police rescued Avi from Sachin’s girlfriend’s house and handed him over to his parents. According to deputy superintendent of police, city, Harish Bhadauria, “Sachin and an associate kidnapped the baby. A case under IPC section 393 (kidnaping) has been registered against accused.Further investigation is on.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman cricket coach booked for thrashing.description: Muzaffarnagar: A case has been registered against a cricket coach, Priti Mehra, posted in the district's stadium here for allegedly thrashing an 18-year-old girl training under her.In their complaint with police, the girl’s family alleged that coach Priti Mehra thrashed Iqra Naaz on Thursday. The girl in question showed bruise marks as a result of the beating with a stick by the coach. It was alleged that the coach has thrashed other girls too. Police are probing the matter and coach Mehra has been booked.After the incident, Naaz’s staged a protest outside the DM office and filed a complaint at the Civil Line police station.According to station house officer of Civil Line police station Navratan Goutam, “A case under IPC sections 323 (punishment for voluntarily causing hurt.), 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace.) and 506 (punishment for criminal intimidation) has been registered against accused and investigation is on. Action will be taken accordingly.”Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman commits suicide over dispute with.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: A 30-year-old woman allegedly committed suicide along with her 7-year-old-daughter by consuming poison in Mansoorpur area. According to the police, the women took the extreme step after an altercation with her husband. According to police, the woman died on way to hospital while the girl died during treatment. The incident took place in Nara village. According to police sources, Minu Sharma consumed poison and gave the same to her daughter Khushi after she reportedly had a minor tiff with her husband Sunil Sharma. Sunil Sharma, husband of deceased, told TOI,"I found that some money was missing from my wallet. While inquiring about it, she and I fought after which I left the house. When I came back, I was informed by my neighbours that my wife and daughter committed suicide. Never would I have imagined that a such small tiff between us can lead to my wife and daughter’s death.” Meanwhile, Minu Sharma’s parents approached the police and have filed a complaint against Sunil Sharma, blaming him for their daughter’s death. Superintendent of police of Muzaffarnagar city, Satpal Antil said, “We have sent the bodies for post-mortem examination. Minu Sharma’s parents have filed a complaint against Sunil. We have ordered probe.” SHO of Mansoorpur police station, Sanjeev Kumar said, “We are waiting for the postmortem report following which appropriate action will be taken.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ushoshi Sengupta.description: KOLKATA: A gang of 10 bikers chased around Kolkata-based model Ushoshi Sengupta’s app cab through the streets of south Kolkata and harassed her — not once but twice — late on Monday night. The last round of harassment occurred after cops at a police station “refused to register her complaint” but, instead, referred her to the “right police station”.   Cops from Bhowanipore arrived around 10-15 minutes later. It was past midnight by then and Sengupta decided to pursue the case on Tuesday morning and requested the cabby to drop her colleague and her off at their homes. But the nightmare was far from being over. “The boys had followed us till my colleague’s house and, right when we were dropping him at Lake Gardens, six of them on three bikes came and stopped the car. They pelted stones, smashing the window. They then dragged me out and tried to break my phone to delete the video. Luckily, local people heard my cries for help and came out. The boys then fled,” Sengupta recalled.   She then called her father and sister; her own residence was just a lane away. They called cops, who came and asked her to file an FIR at the Charu Market police station. It was 1.30 a.m. when she reached there but, instead of taking down her complaint, the cops there directed her to Bhowanipore police station where the first assault had occured. “I just gave up and started shouting at this point. There was no female police officer. The officer there finally took down my complaint after asking a lot of questions but refused to take the cabby’s complaint, stating that two FIR could not be taken for the same incident,” she said. Frustrated and hapless, she returned home. It was at 2.30 p.m. on Tuesday that she posted the entire ordeal on Facebook along with a 20-second video clip. An additional CP later called Sengupta and assured her of strong action against not just the accused but an inquiry into police refusal to take her complaint citing jurisdiction issues. “The probe has just begun and we have identified all the culprits. More arrests are likely and we will probe whether there was lack of adequate response from cops,” said a Lalbazar official. The arrested were identified as Sheikh Rahit, Fardeen Khan, Sheikh Shabir Ali, Sheikh Gani, Sheikh Imran Ali, Sheikh Wasim and Atif Khan alias Md Samsad. A preliminary inquiry revealed the cab had accidentally brushed against the bike, causing the riders to lose balance. One of the bikes’ rear view mirrors broke and the youths accosted cabby Tarak Debnath to demand compensation. At least two more bikes and an auto carrying more people landed there, leading to the sequence of events ending with the assault at Lake Gardens, officials said. Man involved in 70 \u2018cash only\u2019.description: Muzaffarnagar: A man involved in over 70 cases of theft was finally arrested by Muzaffarnagar police on Thursday. Surprisingly, Ansaar Ahmed, 23, had no mention in police records as he operated alone and left without a trace. Besides, he targeted only cash and left other valuables of his victims untouched. According to police, Ahmed believed that forming a gang would have led to an easy arrest. On Sunday, he was caught while stealing Rs 62,000 cash from a seed store on Court Road. During the interrogation, Ahmed confessed to have been involved in 70 theft cases in Muzaffarnagar and adjoining districts. Police recovered Rs 62,000 cash which was stolen from the seed shop. According to superintendent of police Satpal Antil, “He has committed 12 thefts in Muzaffarnagar and 60 thefts in the Meerut zone. He operates alone and has no other associate because he feels if he forms a gang, there would be no privacy. A police team has been sent to his home to recover other stolen goods and cash.” Five police teams were formed to solve the theft in the pesticide shop. After receiving a tip-off, a police team from Civil Lines police station arrested him from a bus stop on Thursday. The SP also claimed to have solved the case of loot at lawyer Urmila Sharma’s house which took place on June 3. Police arrested three culprits and recovered Rs 3.5 lakh from them. UP releases Rs 20 cr for uniforms of gov.description: Meerut: In what is being considered as a welcome move, a sum of Rs 20 crore has been released for purchasing school uniforms for UP government schoolchildren. However, the money has been released only for non BPL students as the funds for uniforms of BPL, SC and ST children comes under Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan and is released by the central government.Unlike previous years, when the money for the uniforms used to be released as late as August, when school was already five months into session, this year, the funds were released two months into the session. “The amount released will be deposited in the bank accounts of school management committees depending on the number of non BPL kids in each school as per records. The share per student is Rs 400 such that they will get two uniforms, costing Rs 200 each,” said Bhola Nath, finance controller, basic shiksha parishad, UP, in his order.The amount should be used in accordance with Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan norms for school uniforms. “The amount used for purchasing school uniforms and the progress of uniform distribution should be updated with the basic shiksha adhikaris and further the state authorities should be informed about the matter,” read Nath’s order.The amount has been released for both primary and upper primary schools for students of Class 1 to VIII. Instructions have also been given to ensure that the budget is used as soon as possible.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Govt should root out terrorism: Father o.description: Muzaffarnagar: Satendra Kumar, a resident of Kivana village in Shamli district, was one of the five CRPF personnel killed in an attack carried out by two terrorists in South Kashmir’s Anantnag on Wednesday. As the grief-stricken family waited for the mortal remains of their son, a pall of gloom engulfed the village.The attack was carried out by two terrorists, believed to be from Jaish-e-Mohammed (JEM), on a busy road in Anantnag district of South Kashmir. Apart from the five CRPF jawans who were killed in the attack, three others were injured. An inspector of the Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) police has also sustained critical injuries.Maniram, father of the slain soldier, urged the government to put an end to terrorism, "so that no other parent has to go through this excruciating pain".According to the family, Satendra Kumar had joined CRPF in 2010 and had been posted in Kashmir for the past two and a half years. He is survived by his wife and two sons, Dipanshu (4), and Vasu (2).After receiving the shocking news from the CRPF headquarters, villagers gathered at his home to pay tribute to the martyr. Maniram said, “He wanted to serve the country and I am proud of him today.” According to a neighbor, “Satendra’s body is expected to arrive here by Thursday evening.”Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Hundreds bid farewell to Major killed in.description: MEERUT: Emotions ran high in the city as politicians and administrative officials made a beeline for late Major Ketan Sharma’s home. His body arrived on Tuesday afternoon at the Remount Veternary Corps Centre and was later moved to his house in Shradhapuri Colony in Kankerkhera region. Hundreds of people spilled onto streets to pay floral homage to Sharma, 32, who was killed in an encounter with militants in Anantnag district of Jammu and Kashmir on Monday morning. A militant was also killed while three Army personnel, including another Major, were injured. The officer's 4-year-old daughtersalutes him one last timeThe slain officer’s body was taken to Surajkund cremation centre in an Army truck amid patriotic slogans raised by the crowds thronging both sides of the road. Sharma’s mortal remains were consigned to flames in the presence of MP Rajinder Agarwal, UP cane minister Suresh Rana and senior administrative officials, including the DM and SSP, apart from Army personnel. Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath has announced an ex gratia of Rs 25 lakh for the kin of the Major and a government job for a family member. A road will also be named in his memory. “Government must do something that no other mother loses her son this way,” an inconsolable Usha Sharma, deceased officer's mother, was heard telling senior Army officers who visited the family. Sharma was posted at 19 Rashtriya Rifles. He was inducted into the Army in December 2012. Sharma is survived by a four-year-old daughter, Kiara, and widow, Ira Sharma. According to the family, he had come home on leave and had left for J&K on May 27 to join his unit. The encounter took place in the Achabal area of South Kashmir's Anantnag district. The injured were rushed to the 92 base hospital of the Army in Srinagar, officials said. The attack on the Major’s team took place almost a week after five CRPF personnel were killed near the same spot in Anantnag district. One of the personnel was from neighbouring Shamli district. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. First dairy moved out of city amidst hea.description: MEERUT: After over an hour-long standoff between Meerut district administration and cattle dairy owners, the first dairy was moved out of the city from Patel Nagar amidst heavy police force on Friday. Two companies of Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC), police force from six police stations and women constables were deployed to remove cattle from the dairy which was started in an unauthorised manner inside the premises of Hindi Bhawan. After initial protests by the dairy owner and other supporters, who sought for more time to remove the cattle from here, accompanied with arguments which continued for over an hour, the cattle were finally removed by the dairy owner under close vigilance of police force and Meerut Municipal Corporation (MMC) authorities. “On the Allahabad High Court’s instructions, all 2200 dairies are to be moved out of the city as they were functioning illegally. The dairy owners had earlier said that they would remove the cattle on their own, but it was not done. This is why, we had to begin the drive against the dairies which have to be moved out of the city by June 30. Initially, the dairy owners were not ready to budge. However, they later agreed to remove the cattle on their own,” said Amit Kumar, additional municipal corporation. The matter has been pending for the past 20 years. In 1998, the Allahabad high court had ordered shifting the dairies out of city limits. However, the order was not complied with. In May this year, the court directed the district authorities to provide land to dairy owners and shift them. “Making cattle colonies and providing a land to the dairy owners is not a pre-condition of the HC order. The Meerut Development Authority (MDA) and Meerut Municipal Corporation (MMC) officials are looking into the matter and once they have a certain plot of land for the purpose, the dairy owners will be given priority for that land,” said Sanjay Pandey, Meerut city magistrate. “Police from six police stations, two companies of PAC and women constables were deployed to provide security at the spot. This was necessary to ensure that no untoward situation occurs at the spot and the crowd can be managed easily. However, since the dairy owner agreed to remove the cattle on his own, everything happened peacefully,” said Dinesh Kumar Shukla, circle officer, Kotwali. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. CCSU to cut down 507 trees for new build.description: MEERUT: Chaudhary Charan Singh (CCS) University administration is all set to cut 507 trees to make way for new buildings for the expansion of various departments on its campus. According to university officials, 507 standing and 356 fallen trees have already been auctioned, and the process of felling standing tress will begin soon. The move has, however, irked locals to whom the university campus serves as a prime destination for morning walk with its immaculate green cover. The university administration, however, claimed that the decision to cut tress was taken after receiving permission from the forest department, and they would plant twice the number of tress than they had fallen. CCSU vice-chancellor NK Taneja said, “The construction of several buildings, including a separate building for evaluation department and expansion of the infrastructure for the existing department of management and other courses, are in the pipeline.” “We will plant more than double than we are felling so that the ecosystem on the campus is not affected,” said Taneja. According to university sources, the auction took place on June 11, and Rs 15.51 lakh came from selling the trees. The process of felling trees and clearing land will begin soon, they confirmed. Vivek Kochar, lawyer and resident of Shastri Nagar area, said, “I have been going for a morning walk on the university campus for the past 25 years. I am really disappointed to learn about the university’s decision. After cantonment, the university campus is the only place with optimum greenery and it should not be destroyed.” The university administration, however, claimed that most of the standing trees (mostly eucalyptus) that they were felling had dried up and could fall abruptly during storm. 1,200 doctors go on 24-hour strike from.description: MEERUT: At least 1,200 doctors under the banner of Indian Medical Association (IMA) are set to go on a 24-hour strike from 6 am, on Monday, in protest against the recent attack on a medical intern at Kolkata’s NRS hospital. As a pre-emptive measure, government hospitals in the state have cancelled leaves of doctors to ensure patients receive proper treatment. “All the doctors in Meerut are going to be a part of the nationwide strike from 6am, June 17 to 6am, June 18. This is being done to protest the attack on a junior doctor in Kolkata. It is disappointing that despite providing health services to the masses, doctors are being thrashed,” said Dr Shishir Jain, president, Meerut unit of IMA. As a mark of protest, doctors in Meerut wore helmets and black badges while they tended to their patients on Friday. “We demand a safer workplace, which is possible only if police security is given to us and also the accused are booked under the sections of Medical Protection Act,” said Dr Jain. On Monday, only emergency services in private hospitals will remain open. Paribaha Mukherjee, a junior doctor in Kolkata’s NRS Medical College, was brutally attacked by a mob of 200 people after a 75-year-old patient died of alleged cardiac arrest. The doctor incurred a skull fracture and had to undergo surgery. The incident raised concerns over doctors’ security all over the country. Authorities at institutes like PL Sharma district hospital and Lala Lajpat Rai Memorial Medical College have cancelled doctors’ leaves, so that patients do not face any inconvenience during the strike. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP education department instructs free s.description: MEERUT: The Uttar Pradesh education department has instructed free school bag distribution to social welfare department run school students from Class I to VIII, by August 20. The state authorities have fixed Rs 113.28 per school bag as the cost of procurement. The district authorities have to conduct the procurement and ensure that good quality bags are distributed timely. Penalty will be issued on the distributor in case of delay in the delivery of bags to the district authorities. “All of you are instructed to see that school bags are distributed for free among students studying in government schools run by the social welfare department from Class I to VIII by August 20. All basic shiksha adhikaris should inform us about the number of school bags needed and in which size – small, medium or large – positively by June 19, 2019, read the order issued by Sarvendra Vikram Bahadur Singh, UP education director (basic). While the small bag size is meant for Class I and II students, the medium is for Class III, IV and V students and large for Class VI, VII and VIII. “First, the quality of the bags should be tested in each district and only when the quality is found satisfactory, the distribution process should be initiated. Also, it should be taken care that if the company in question delays the distribution, a penalty will be imposed on the organisation,” read the order issued by Singh. The penalty imposed for a one-week delay will be 1% value of the delayed quantity, for a two-week delay will be 2% of the delayed quantity and so on till the fourth week. However, if the supplier fails to deliver the school bags, even after the fourth week, the directorate may exercise the option of termination of agreement and forfeiture of the security deposit amount. For avoidance of doubt, it is made clear that for calculation of penalty ‘part of the week’ shall be treated as ‘full week’. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Missing man\u2019s body with bullet inju.description: BIJNOR: Body of a youth working as supervisor in a private company in Punjab’s Amritsar was found in a field at Rahdara village under Gajraula police station in Amroha on Friday. The youth was missing since Thursday evening. The body bore a bullet injury. The deceased identified as Rohit Kumar (22) had come to his native village four days ago. He went missing on Thursday around 5pm. When he did not return home, his family members started searching for him. On Friday morning, his father, Balveer Singh, who is a home guard, went to his sugarcane field and spotted his son’s body lying in a pool of blood. A bullet had hit his head. A countrymade pistol and a used cartridge was lying near the body. A shocked Balveer Singh informed his family members and police. Neeraj Kumar, Gajraula station house officer, said “Police are probing the matter. It is yet to ascertained whether Rohit was murdered or he committed suicide. A case will be registered based on the complaint filed by his family.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Six minor girls raped in last seven days.description: BIJNOR: There has been a spate of rapes of minor girls in Bijnor with as many as six such cases reported in the district in the past seven days. The latest one was reported on Sunday evening where a seven-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her neighbour in Bijnor’s Kiratpur area. The accused has been arrested. In the other rape cases, the minors were aged between seven and 16 years. FIRs have been lodged. The latest crime was reported at Jataan Mohalla of Kiratpur town on Sunday evening and the accused was arrested on Monday. According to police, 21-year-old neighbour, Aaseef, lured the girl and took her to his house, raped her and then fled. The girl’s family and other neighbours came to her rescue. Locals and the girl’s family informed the police and took her to a private hospital. She is stated to be out of danger. The police have registered a case under section 376 of IPC and POCSO Act. Aaseef has been arrested. Addressing a press conference, superintendent of police, Sanjeev Tyagi, claimed that police have taken cognizance of the crime, arrested the accused and sent him to prison. In other recent rape cases, a 15-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her friend’s 22-year-old brother at her friend’s house on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday. The minor’s family has alleged that the girl’s 19-year-old friend had taken the girl to her house at Paadali Mandu village under Dhampur police station area. The girl remained missing from her house on Saturday night and narrated her ordeal to the family on Sunday. In another case, a 16-year-old girl in Dhampur area accused a 22-year-old neighbour of raping her following which a case was registered. Police arrested the accused and sent him to jail. It took place at Nai Saray Mohalla of Bijnor’s Dhampur. On June 13, two minors - aged seven and eight - were raped in two separate rape cases under Barhapur police station in Bijnor. The police registered the two cases and made arrests. The crime was committed in Sikkawala and Ismaelpur villages. One girl was asleep while the other was going to a wedding. In yet another case, a 16-year-old girl was raped after Saddam allegedly entered her house and raped her at Meerapur Mohli in Bijnor’s Afzalgarh area on June 12. An FIR was filed and the police have booked Saddam. Dr Beena Singh, a social worker, told TOI, “Minor girls are soft targets for rapists. They cannot resist the advances of these men. Parents should be more careful and keep a watch on their girls’ whereabouts. And they should not leave their daughter alone. They should always interact with their children. Also, prompt and strict action should be taken in such crimes by police and court.” Bijnor superintendent of police, Sanjeev Tyagi, assured, “The police are taking strict and prompt action against the accused. Parents should also maintain a close watch on their girls.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Meerut: One killed in firing at panchaya.description: MEERUT: One person was killed and three injured in firing at a panchayat in a Baghpat village held to settle a marital discord late on Sunday evening. The incident took place at Soop village in Ramala region of the district. After the panchayat broke into a verbal war, four people were shot at. One of them died on the spot while three were admitted to a local hospital. According to police sources, Sonia, a resident of Kapurgarh village of Muzaffarnagar was married to Bhupender Singh of Soop village ten years ago. The couple has three kids. They had strained marital ties and several panchayats had been held in the past to resolve the matter. In one such effort on Sunday, Sonia’s relatives -- including brothers Bhagat Singh, Ajit Singh and other relatives -- reached Soop village to take Sonia back home for which a panchayat was held. The panchayat ruled that Sonia's kin could take her to Muzaffarnagar on Monday. However, her brothers wanted to take her on Sunday itself which led to a heated argument between two groups. “Both the families and their associates had met in village Soop to settle the matter on Sunday evening. However, during heated arguments between the two groups, someone fired shots that hit four elders. Out of them one Mohkam Singh, 55, died on the spot. The other three are admitted to a local hospital and currently out of danger. Investigations are on and we are trying to figure out how it all began,” said additional SP Ranvijay Singh. Police sources reveal that out of four persons who were hit three -- including Mohkam who died -- belonged to Bhupender’s group. The one injured from Sonia’s side was Bhagat Singh. “We all were trying to convince panchayat elders to allow us to take Sonia on Sunday night itself but they became adamant and at that time only shots were fired. We were targeted by Sonia’s in-laws. I was hit in the back.” Baghpat SP Shailesh Kumar Pandey said: “We have detained five members from Sonia’s family, including Sonia herself, and are questioning them. The two other injured Sudhir and Raju are out of danger.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Two minor girls raped in Bijnor.description: Bijnor: Two minors aged seven and eight years old were allegedly raped at two different places under Barhapur police station area here. Police have arrested a suspect and registered two cases.The first case was reported from a village under the jurisdiction of Nagina police station. The mother of the minor survivor lodged a complaint with police on Thursday, alleging that her daughter was raped by a relative at Sikkawala village under Barhapur police station area on Tuesday. The girl had gone there along with her father to attend a wedding. The accused allegedly picked her up, took her to a field and raped her, her mother claimed. The family learnt about the crime on June 12 when the girl returned home. The family suspected something was amiss as the girl was frightened and nervous. When asked, narrated her ordeal to them. Police have registered a case against the alleged culprit under IPC section 376 (rape) and provisions of the POCSO Act. He has been arrested.Another minor was allegedly ‘raped’ in a village under the jurisdiction of Barhapur police station on the intervening night of Wednesday and Thursday. Her family members claimed that a 22-year-old neighbour abducted the eight-year-old while she was asleep in her house and took her to a field and raped her. The girl’s family members filed a complaint on Thursday at Barhapur police station. Police have registered a case. The accused is on the run as of now. Police have claimed that it was an attempt to rape.Addressing a press conference, city superintendent of police Lakhsmi Niwas Mishra said, “The crimes were committed at separate villages under Barhapur police station area. Police have registered a case against the accused under 376 of IPC and POCSO Act. The girls were sent to the district hospital for medical examination and treatment.”Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Four killed as tractor-trailer overturns.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: Four labourers were killed when a tractor-trailer carrying bricks overturned in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut on Tuesday, police said.  The deceased, identified as Nazim (28), Kamil (32), Rizwan (30) and Kamil (34), belonged to Jolla village in Muzaffarnagar, police added.  The bodies have been sent for a post-mortem examination. BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

650 transformers \u2018blow off\u2019 th.description: BIJNOR: Around 25 transformers in western UP’s Bijnor district are ‘blowing off’ every day due to huge power overload this summer. And the constant malfunctioning of transformers is leading to massive power outages in the district causing much inconvenience to the people in this scorching heat. Power department officials claimed that on an average 10-12 transformers ‘blow off’ in other seasons. But, the count nearly doubled this summer with around 650 transformers stopped functioning between May 14 and June 14, the officials admitted. And as a result, with regular power cuts, the people – battling the severe heat wave - are living in hellish conditions. Some of the transformers have been badly damaged during the ongoing heat wave. It was 46 degrees Celsius recorded in Bijnor on Saturday. So, it is problem aplenty for Paschimanchal Vidyut Vitran Nigam Limited. According to sources, there is a provision that burnt transformers should be replaced within 24 hours in a city and 72 hours in rural areas. But here, the power corporation has failed to replace the transformers on time. Assistant engineer at a workshop, Susheel Kumar, said, “With rising temperature, cases of burning transformers have doubled. Earlier, under normal situation, around 10 to 12 transformers were burning out in a day while at present, the numbers have reached 22 to 25 per day. Most of the burning transformers are of ‘25KVA’.” Kumar also said, “In summer, both power consumption and load usually shoots up resulting in damaging the transformer. There are over 70,000 tubewells in the district which almost runs every day to irrigate the crop. Here, the main crop is sugarcane which requires more irrigation than others. Besides, AC, fans and coolers are used in excess. We are trying our best to replace the burnt transformers.” The transformers which ‘blow off’ also pose a threat to the people, particularly in populated areas. Arbaaz Khan, a resident of Sherkot, said, “Blowing off transformers is common for villagers in summer season. But, the situation is very bad this year. On Friday, a transformer in Halwaeyaan Mohalla of Sherkot suddenly caught fire. There was panic all around but luckily no one was hurt. Power corporation authorities should do regular inspections of the transformers - maintain it properly and check its load from time to time.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Neighbour rapes minor, arrested.description: BIJNOR: A 22-year-old man was arrested in Bijnor and sent to jail on Saturday after his neighbor, a 16-year-old girl, accused him of raping her. According to the police, the incident took place on Friday evening. Accused Mohammad Sadiq barged into the room of the girl and raped her. The police said that after committing the crime Sadiq escaped. A case was registered against the accused under section 376 of IPC and POCSO Act on the late Friday night after which the accused was arrested the next morning. Bijnor superintendent of police Sanjeev Tyagi, said, “We have arrested Sadiq. He was at large since Friday evening.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Light rain cools down city.description: MEERUT: Light showers in Meerut brought immediate relief for the residents as temperatures dipped at least four degrees below normal on Tuesday. Intermittent drizzles were witnessed in the city on Monday night and Tuesday. The city recorded a rainfall of 2.2mm, following which the weather changed to pleasant after a long spell of intense heat. The maximum and minimum temperatures recorded on Tuesday in Meerut were 33.4 and 21.2 degrees Celsius respectively. The maximum and minimum humidity levels recorded here were 73% and 47% respectively. “The mercury dipped considerably giving the city residents relief from the heat. While the maximum temperature dipped three degrees below normal, the minimum temperature dipped four degrees,” said Brij Mohan, Met in-charge, Meerut. Meteorological department officials say that rainfall and thunderstorm are predicted for the entire week and temperatures are likely to dip further. The sudden rain has been attributed to a western disturbance over Pakistan and effects of cyclone Vayu, which is bringing moisture laden winds to north India. Northern states such as Punjab and Haryana also have been witnessing a dip in the temperature following instances of light rain. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Four women among 11 booked, held for fra.description: MEERUT: Four women, including an alleged rape survivor, were among 11 booked and arrested for hatching a conspiracy to frame a Bulandshahr man in rape case. According to initial complaint, a minor girl was abducted by three men, and she was sedated and raped by Jitu, the prime accused. Investigation in the case, however, exposed the conspiracy with police claiming that the alleged raped survivor, her mother and aunt were hired by one Manish, who wanted to settle his scores with his rival Jitu by framing him in a rape case. According to Buladshahr superintendent of police (rural) Manish Kumar Mishra, the conspiracy was hatched at the Bulandshahr district prison, where Manish was lodged in an attempt to murder case on the complaint of Jitu. Manish was, however, released on a bail last month. In the prison, Manish met convicts Dabbu, Yogesh and Pawan and hired them to frame Jitu in a rape case. The trio later hired a woman and her daughter with the help of their acquaintance Prabha, who allegedly masterminded the plan outside jail, said the SP. The SP said police picked up several aberrations in the story concocted by the alleged rape survivor, who claimed that she was abducted and raped by Jitu on June 13. “We crosschecked statements of the girl with the details her call records. The time around the incident happened, she was continuously in touch with her mother and aunt,” said the SP. “As the investigation progressed, the medical tests confirmed that the girl was not a minor. Her mother later confessed that her daughter is a mother of a child. The gang broke down during investigation and confessed to have hatched a conspiracy to frame Jitu at the behest of Manish,” another investigator said. Meanwhile, registering a fresh case in this connection, police have booked 11 accused, including three convicts serving sentences, Manish, and the four women. Police have also arrested the alleged rape survivor, her mother, aunt and another woman as co-conspirators. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

House crumbles in M\u2019nagar, 6-yr-old.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: About 12 members of a family had a miraculous escape when their duplex house caved in on Tuesday morning. However, a six-year-old boy died in the incident that happened in village Hind of Thanabhawan town of Shamli district. According to police sources, Gayyur Ahmad along with his six brothers and their families stayed in a duplex house. On Tuesday morning, suddenly the roof of the upper story began crumbling leading to panic and more than 20 members of the family ran outside the house shouting for help. Six others were buried while escaping but locals rushed in for help and saved five members. Later, during the rescue operation conducted by the police, Faizan's body was recovered from the rubbles. All injured are being treated at district hospital. Deputy Superintendent of police, Surender Yadav said," Primary investigation has revealed that due to cracking of house's main beam, the building had collapsed. A further investigation is on into the matter.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

As 90% hand pumps dry up, 15 Bijnor vill.description: BIJNOR: People living in as many as 15 villages in Bijnor have been facing a water crisis due to a dip in groundwater by three metres for long. The problem has become acute this summer with 90% of the government hand pumps in the area drying up. Now, villagers are forced to fetch water from far off places. For the residents of these villages located in Najibabad, Afjalgarh and Kotwali Dehat development blocks, they can only look up at the sky praying to the rain god to shower them with rainfall during the coming monsoon as their repeated pleas for resolving their water scarcity problem to the authorities have fallen on deaf ears. The water scarcity problem has been looming large over the 15 villages including Jalalpur, Nakipur, Bharatpur Mitho, Kayam Nagar, Tanda Sahuwala, Harvanshwala, Sikkawala, Garhi, Sardarpur Chhaeli, Shiriya and Chak and Rampur. Talking with TOI, village head of Shiriya, Birmo Devi, said, “It is a long-standing problem. Every summer, villagers face drinking water crisis. Now, private hand pumps have dried up while government’s India Marka hand pumps have also stopped lifting water. A few that work are spewing dirty water. I have prepared a project to install around six deep-bore hand pumps at the village. The project is in the pipeline.” Hukum Singh, a villager of Jalalpur, said, “There are over 25 India Marka hand pumps at my village. But only three of them are working. Every day, from early morning, villagers, especially women, queue up to draw water. We have been demanding for years that water be supplied through pipeline but no action has been taken in this regard.” Villagers told TOI that water scarcity has affected farmers who are unable to irrigate their crops. The area faces shortage of water despite the fact that as many as seven rivers, including the Ganga, flow through the district. Experts attribute the water woes of the region to over-exploitation of groundwater. When TOI contacted the executive engineer of Jal Nigam, Bharat Singh, he said, “I am aware about the problems faced by the residents of these villages. In summer, groundwater level there dips by three meters. We can install only those hand pumps that can draw water from a depth of 30 to 50 metres. Given the terrain, it is not possible to bore deeper. Only piped water supply scheme can resolve the crisis. We are making a plan for the same.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .
